intro: Zantedeschia pentlandii, commonly known as the White Calla Lily, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It features large, showy white spatheae that enclose the small, greenish-yellow spathes, creating a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Araceae family, which is characterized by its unique inflorescence structure. Zantedeschia pentlandii typically grows in wet, marshy environments and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
